p.s: In the following comment I am going to discuss, if the Child ProtectivProtective Services should have taken Pearl away from her mother Margot when they were living together in an old Ford Mercury on the visitors parking lot of the Indian Waters Trailer Park in the middle of nowhere in Florida.
It is very difficuiltdifficult to say what a child in the age of 14 needs in such a situation.
I have to admit that the living conditions on the trailer park are very rough.
The park is located next to a dump that intoxicates the whole area and there is no shower for Pearl and her mother, but it is not that easy to say that Pearl should get taken away.
On the trailer park she has found a home that she has lived in for her whole life.
She has made friends and her mother really loves her, teaches her a lot of important things and sends her to school to get a good education.

The fact that they need to be afraid of the CPSChild Protective Service is only hindering them to earn more money and making more friends and on the example of Helen you can see how terrible the life conditions of a child can get when it is is trapped in the supposedly helping system of being passed around by the foster homes.

So in my opinion the work of the CPSChild Protective Service is innecessary or even negatively impacting the life of Pearl and Margot and I really think that Margot is raising Pearl to a well educated, independent and clever woman.
Taking everything into acountaccount I think that taking Pearl away from Margot and that her life in the trailer park is better for her and her future than it would be in a foster home.
